pullRequest.title: Add new tests for preference panels.

commit.message: add tests for decendents of PreferencesPanel

nodes.bodyText:
This class should use a generic PreferencesPanelTestBase

to avoid any potential need to cast prefsPanel to the tested class in the actual test classes.

We have not stipulated that all preferences tabs in a tabbed pane require a tooltip, so, yes, those classes that return null for the preferences tooltip should return null (the method that cares is javax.swing.JTabbedPane.insertTab(...) and it accepts null for a tooltip).

Tooltips should only be used when they can provide more information, and a tooltip displayed in the Preferences window over "Consist Control" that reads "Preferences for the consist tool" doesn't. I would remove this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,3 +53,4 @@ ScanConsists = Scan Roster for Consists
 WriteCVToRosterOption = Update CV19 in roster when modifying advanced consists
 WriteCVToRosterToolTip = When modifying advanced consists, CV19 is changed.  Selecting this option to update the roster entry, when known, when CV19 is updated.
 StartupConsistToolAction=Open Consisting Tool
+ConsistPreferencesToolTip = Preferences for the consist tool.

nodes.bodyText: Since a preferences panel controls if it is put into a tab with another preference panel or not, you should expect that preferences panels that are not under tabs will return null for the title for the tab.

The only preferences panels that should not be returning null label keys are preferences panels that are tabbed together with other preferences panels. Panels showing up in the list on the preferences window should be returning null for label keys.
Since the PreferencesPanel interface stipulates no requirement of nullness, this test should not assert is not null. If it is to assert anything, it should assert there is no exception.
Since the PreferencesPanel interface stipulates no requirement of nullness, this test should not assert is not null. If it is to assert anything, it should assert there is no exception.
